perturbation.original_text:
Watchit agrees to provide Oceanic Time Warner Cable the following content:
– Watchit Gaming Guides
– Lunchtime with Ira segments every week
Watchit will provide the content on BetaSp format and reserves the right to modify the content to reflect sponsorship by an advertiser and
advertisers.
perturbation.changed_text:
Watchit agrees to provide Oceanic Time Warner Cable the following content:
– Watchit Gaming Guides
– Lunchtime with Ira segments every week
Watchit will provide the deliverables in a digital format and reserves the right to modify the content to reflect sponsorship by an advertiser and
advertisers.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'the content on BetaSp format' to 'the deliverables in a digital format' introduces ambiguity. It's unclear if 'content' and 'deliverables' are the same, and the term 'digital format' is too broad compared to the original more specific 'BetaSp format', therefore, uncertainty in the type of deliverables is created.

perturbation.original_text:
Oceanic Time Warner Cable agrees to not edit or modify the above content.
Oceanic Time Warner Cable will use the content solely on channel 777, the Las Vegas channel.
perturbation.changed_text:
Oceanic Time Warner Cable agrees to not edit or modify the above programming.
Oceanic Time Warner Cable will use the content solely on channel 777, the Las Vegas channel.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'content' to 'programming' in the first sentence creates confusion. Are 'content' and 'programming' interchangeable? Does the restriction on editing/modifying apply to all 'content' or just the specific 'programming' mentioned? This introduces a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text:
Ocean Time Warner Cable will provide Watchit with data on viewership to both Channel 777 and specifically to the content provided by Watchit.
Ocean Time Warner Cable will be able to not include any content that it deems inappropriate or distasteful.
perturbation.changed_text:
Ocean Time Warner Cable will provide Watchit with data on viewership to both Channel 777 and specifically to the programming provided by Watchit.
Oceanic Time Warner Cable will be able to not include any material that it deems inappropriate or distasteful.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'content' to 'programming' and 'material' in different sentences without defining them can cause disputes. It creates uncertainty. Does 'data on viewership' apply to 'programming' or all 'content'? Can Oceanic Time Warner Cable exclude only 'material,' or does the power to exclude extend to broader forms of 'content'?
